text: Anyone know if it is possible to insert an image after a form 'submit' button using a psuedo element? Looking to add a custom arrow that follows the submit link. I tried with plain HTML / CSS but it didn't want to display inline, just underneath.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

you have a live link?
To stage site, or template url?
so I can see what you have going on
<http://697792-hs-sites-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/home>
At the footer, looking to add the arrow after form submit "im interested"
so, you are being overwritten by HubSpot default styling
in the form options you can check a box that removes default HubSpot styling
if that messes up your current styling, then what you can do is just add
background: url(’<https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hubfs/697792/CAL-SITE-2017/image-library/white-arrow-r.svg'>)!important;
!important to the end
also you will need
background-repeat: no-repeat;
you are going to have to use !importants for a few of these items if you are unable to remove the default styling
you will also need a background-size: property to size your arrow
I know what you are talking about with the default styling, that box is actually un-checked.
and you will need some padding on the right
OH hubtheme
hubtheme?
<https://imgur.com/a/Tx9ac>
that script is the embed code for the form, where would the css be applied? to a div that is wrapping it?
it is doing the background
you can probably just target teh form a little better and you won’t need importants
ohhh, like a default stylesheet in content settings?
and change `background:` to `background-image:`
ok. let me look into removing/
unless you're going to use the shorthand for all the properties/styles
yeah, i generally using background url() center right no-repeat
yikes – i removed that temporarily and the whole site nearly exploded lol
LOLOL
is anyone else still seeing delays in updates?
Made an update to an advanced menu and it still hasn't populated a few mins later
<@U6TBZ66FN>
Our CDN has been having some trouble today so we lowered the invalidation time
good to know...thanks!
If you DM the portal Id I can make sure it is purged so you don't have to wait anymore
CDN issue seems recovered and I have restored the cache time. If you are still seeing the cache issue. That might be a bug, please let me know.
it updated as you commented so I think it was resolved
did you want me to DM the portal info anyway?
Nope now that is working

one more random for the day, we were having issues with an embedded blog comment form not submitting, the code was correct and the one thing that fixed it was making a random change so we could republishing the form. Is this normal?
Do you have a redirect page set up? It may need one and is not set
It's using an inline-thank you message and has for many years
They're might be an issue with the javascript or an unclosed div tag on the template.

We checked the code and everything looked to be in order. Forcing the form to refresh made it work again...it's just not an issue we've had come up before with a form that's been in place for a long time.
